report.title: PCP back in the day
report.author: legofeel
report.bodytext: /n Back in my college days I was offered 'Angel Dust' which was explained to me to be formaldehyde sprayed on mint leaves. It looked and smelled to this pre-med student to be an accurate description. A couple of tokes produced one of the more unpleasant drug experiences I ever had; something akin to being plugged into an electrical outlet. /n /n That same year (late 70's), PCP pills were rather abundant; little purple or orange barrels, and I enjoyed them a lot - pleasant disassociatives that went nicely with a couple of beers; Like a dirty form of ketamine, though I never journeyed into anything I could call a 'P-hole'. /n /n I had a very nice summer vacation at home that year, doing PCP at the beach or under the sun in my parents back yard. A year later I started reading in the newspapers how PCP was supposed to make me hack up my family with the uncontrollable strength of ten men... oh well, maybe next time. /n /n legofeel
